The affected package was updated in that PR, but vulnerable versions were re-added in 059b64f2e311a4d26b72c50c0598a17749238d88 and #4311.

For the yarn-based file, I had to use a `resolution` in addition to an override as the vulnerable package was being imported indirectly via a dependency.

prs.title: feat: add finalization checker for monitoring block synchronization across multiple RPCs
prs.truncated_body: This new script allows monitoring of finalized blocks from specified RPC endpoints, reporting state changes between synchronized and unsynchronized states for finalized blocks. It includes functionality for polling at configurable intervals and logging the results for analysis.

commits.message:
feat: add finalization checker for monitoring block synchronization across multiple RPCs

This new script allows monitoring of finalized blocks from specified RPC endpoints, reporting state changes between synchronized and unsynchronized states for finalized blocks. It includes functionality for polling at configurable intervals and logging the results for analysis.

refactor: update RPC endpoints in finalization checker

Replaced the existing endpoints with new mainnet URLs for Chainstack, LinkPool, and SimplyVC. Added functionality to track and log changes in block numbers for each endpoint, enhancing monitoring capabilities.

refactor: improve block number initialization in finalization checker

Updated the initialization of minBlock to use math.MaxUint64 for better handling of block number comparisons. Adjusted linting comment for clarity and compliance with security guidelines.

chore: revert mainnet/testnet to standard reth

Keep bera-reth only for local development as it's not production ready.
Mainnet and testnet targets continue using paradigmxyz/reth.

chore: add TODO comments for future bera-reth migration

Mark testnet and mainnet targets for future migration to bera-reth
when it becomes production ready.

fix: add absolute paths for bera-reth compatibility

Bera-reth requires absolute paths (/) in container due to path resolution
differences from standard reth. Standard reth works with relative paths
but bera-reth needs absolute paths to locate genesis files and data dirs.

Added documentation comment explaining this difference.

docs: document bera-reth path resolution bug

Added detailed comments explaining the root cause of the path resolution
issue in the custom reth fork at chainspec.rs:71. The parse_genesis function
uses shellexpand::full() but doesn't resolve relative paths to absolute paths,
causing failures in Docker containers when the working directory differs.

fix: revert to relative paths after bera-reth path resolution fix

The path resolution bug in bera-reth has been fixed in the latest
Docker image. This removes the need for absolute paths (/) in
container arguments, reverting all paths back to relative paths
to match the original reth configuration.

- Remove absolute path documentation comments
- Revert all Docker container paths to relative format
- Update to fixed bera-reth image tag

fix: update to bera-reth Docker image in testing.mk

Replace paradigmxyz/reth with berachain/bera-reth:nightly
to use the custom Berachain execution client that includes
path resolution fixes and Berachain-specific features.

chore: keep mainnet/testnet on standard reth with TODO

Revert mainnet and testnet reth configurations back to standard
paradigmxyz/reth with TODO comments for future bera-reth migration
once it's production ready for these networks.

Update Kurtosis reth configuration to use bera-reth CLI commands

bera-reth Docker image.

prs.title: go/storage/mkvs: Parallelize checkpoint creation
prs.truncated_body:
Closes #6218 

For context please read [design doc](https://github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/issues/5752#issuecomment-2941540845). To see where this PR fits in, see _Implementation and Validation Plan/2_.

For the discussion about need to release new version read the https://github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/pull/6204#issuecomment-2964592470 and replies.

commits.message:
go/storage/mkvs/checkpoint: Extract chunk creation

Checkpoint creation logic should be decoupled from
checkpoint storage and lifecycle management (Creator).

Using this separation we can test creation logic in isolation.

Given above Creator description, it might be appropriate
to rename it to Manager.
go/storage/mkvs/syncer: Add warning about proof size

go/node: Enable configuration of checkpointing algorithm

Consensus and runtimes can optionally configure checkpointing
algorithm. By default we still use sequential one.

go/worker/storage/committe: Sort checkpoints by peer count

P2p network can now have checkpoints from two checkpointing
algorithms, each one producing distinct checkpoint for the
same root. (In addition to potential byzantine ones...).

Observe that underylying checkpoint version is the same,
since chunks have the same format, and same restorer
can be used.

Sorting them by number of peers is desirable since it:
    1. decreases overloading early upgraders of the
       the new chunking algorithm.
    2. makes it more reliable for the clients.

go/oasis-test-runner: Use a mix of old and new checkpointers

A bit naive, probably dedicated test or only changing the
fixture on relevant ones would be better.

prs.title: Fix bug in rpcchainvm where `io.EOF` is not propagated correctly
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

The `io.EOF` type is an important sentinel value that is used to signal that there is no more data left to read. Currently, our code just copies the error string which loses the type information which is needed to detect `io.EOF`.

ref: https://cs.opensource.google/go/go/+/refs/tags/go1.24.4:src/io/io.go;l=38-39

Add a missing [EIP2](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-2.md#specification) check

prs.title: fix: Set latest freeze round in platform state from Browser
prs.truncated_body:

This PR populates the new field in platform state that stores the latest freeze round. This value is used by the node to determine if an event was created with the current software version or an earlier one. Without this value, the platform thinks all events were created with the current version and it tries to checks the signatures in PCES events on the loaded state hash. Becau

prs.title: Fix build errors and nullable reference warnings
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary
This PR resolves all build errors and nullable reference type warnings in the project to ensure clean builds with nullable reference types enabled.

## Changes Made

### Build Errors Fixed
- **RpcStore.cs**: Removed undefined `OnNewSnapshot` event that referenced non-existent `IStore.OnNewSnapshotDelegate`
- **RpcStore.cs**: Removed invocation of the undefined event in `GetSnapshot()` m

commits.message:
fix: resolve nullable reference type warnings in Neo.SmartContract.Framework

This commit fixes all nullable reference type warnings (CS8618, CS8625, CS8604, CS8602, CS8600)
in the Neo.SmartContract.Framework project to ensure clean builds with nullable reference types enabled.

Changes include:
- Added nullable annotations to method parameters accepting null values (GAS, NEO, Runtime)
- Used null-forgiving operators for fields initialized at runtime (Native classes, token states)
- Added pragma directives to suppress CS8618 for runtime-populated service classes
- Fixed nullable parameter types in delegate signatures and PostTransfer methods
- Used null-forgiving operators in storage access and Contract.Call invocations

This resolves all nullable reference warnings in the Framework project, resulting in a clean build.

fix: remove non-existent OnNewSnapshot event from RpcStore

The RpcStore was referencing IStore.OnNewSnapshotDelegate which doesn't exist
in the IStore interface, causing compilation errors. This removes the undefined
event and its invocation from the GetSnapshot method.

This resolves build errors CS0426 and CS0066 in the Testing project.

Fix GitHub Actions failure by implementing IStore.OnNewSnapshot event in RpcStore

- Add OnNewSnapshot event implementation to comply with IStore interface requirements
- Event is properly invoked when GetSnapshot() is called
- Resolves CS0535 compilation error in GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
